question:
Consider the following bodies/authorities:
  1. Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB)
  2. National Ganga River Basin Authority (NGRBA) 
  3. National Tiger Conservation Authority 
  Which of the above is/are chaired by the Prime Minister?
explanation: Chairman of the National Tiger Conservation Authority is Minister for Environment & Forests. National Ganga River Basin Authority (NGRBA) is chaired by Prime Minister. The Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) of India is a statutory organisation under the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change (MoEF & CC). The board is led by its chairman, who is nominated by the Central Government.
